author: Coen V
title: Nice Meeting facilities close to the centre of Kampala
text:
For an international conference of the stop child learn coalition I stayed a week at the Forest Cottages. I was lucky and got a cottage with the bedroom below on the terras side of the hotel. Room was clean, even had a small kitchenette which I hardly used but can be an asset if you for a longer stay don't want to eat out all the time. Bed and Klamboe were clean and ok en bathroom although basic, provided plenty of hot-water for shower and shave. Had diner, breakfast, lunch all there and even for large groups it was okay and not expensive. Conference room not to spacey but can held up to 30 persons with translations booths and the adding terras is a bliss. Staff is very nice.
Room Tip: If given the choice I would go for the terras side, the nightly howls of the monkeys are authentic... See more room tips
